## Public Member Functions

### convertInitializerTo() {#ae0a2c1bf6f739220d3c473c0bdcd588b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; BitInit::convertInitializerTo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recty">RecTy</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Convert to a value whose type is <code>Ty</code>, or return null if this is not possible.

This can happen if the value&#39;s type is convertible to <code>Ty</code>, but there are unresolved references.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00574">574</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l00444">444</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.

### isConcrete() {#ae6e746fbbe51cab5994a306cc357c821}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::BitInit::isConcrete () const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Is this a concrete and fully resolved value without any references or stuck operations?

Unset values are concrete.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00581">581</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.
